rComments: Cailloux gives a lot of work and expects everyone to participate fully. Slacking off is pretty much impossible. She's a very helpful woman so do not hesitate to ask questions or go to her office hours. I've taken both 3 and 4 with her now. Like many language classes, hers are demanding and linear. Make sure you're really interested in French.

Madame Cailloux is easily the best teacher I have ever had. Sure, there is a lot of reading and work that has to go into the class. But its to learn a whole new language, so it comes with the territory. But Cailloux makes learning about French and the French culture really fun! She does randomly call on EVERYONE in class so make sure to do the hw

Jesus Christ! If this was the only class you were taking, it'd be okay. The assignments are simple, but they are piled one on top of another. She teaches way too fast for any beginning French student. I wouldn't take this class unless you were pursuing French past the first class.

Overall an easy grader, received average marks through out class but still got an A in the course. Her accent was hard to understand sometimes and she thinks that we know more than we've been taught, but otherwise the class is survivable. Workload is average for a language course.

M. Cailloux was not very helpful at all. She would often get angry at our class if we did made a mistake. As the quarter progressed, the more angry she got, and the more work she assigned each day. I was very enthused about taking this class after taking French 2 and 3 but now, I don't even want to continue. She's not a very helpful lady.

She is a good professor, make sure you come to class cos she grades all the class participation and gives extra credit too. She is very strict with submissions and stuff. Make sure u do your homework and dont miss any test or quizzes.
Mme Cailloux is amazing! So nice and loves to help you. Tests are hard and she gives a ton of hw but it's a great class! :) love her!

Madame is hilarious and brilliant and made my freshman year in French incredibly enjoyable. The homework load is perfectly manageable, however the book is very expensive, so don't enroll if you don't have $130 available to spend. She gives detailed study guides for tests, and follows through. She expects effort and participation.

Madame Cailloux is a doll! She's the sweetest woman I know, always willing to help and explain things over and over. Her tests are pretty time-consuming and at times a little difficult if you haven't completely mastered the material, but overall her teaching is superb! I took French 3-5 with her and loved every minute of it :)

Madam Cailloux is an excellent French professor. Her exams can be tough and at times there is a lot of homework. Be prepared to put in time for any language class. She really did help make my french 10x better. I learned more in one quarter with her than 4 years in High School. Highly recommend taking french with her.
